;## 2: Dead monk with arrows in back next to plynth. Axe on plynth. 1d3 skeletons. 1d4 zombies.

!player = PCs.player_forsaken_alley()
!player.massive_attack = True
!player.base_defense # 7
!player.defense # 12
!player.armor # 5
!player.hp # 11
!location # start
!turn = 1

# Your Starting Stats

* Warrior: 5 - Determines proficency with strength and fighting related skills.
* Rogue: 2 - Determines proficency with agility and stealth related skills.
* Mage: 3 - Determines proficency with mana and mental related skills.

## Pools

* Fate: 2 - Divine intervention used to avoid otherwise nasty death or circumstances. Use is automatic. Does not refill.
* Armor_Penalty: -1 - Penalty against mana pool based on armor worn.
* Hit Points: 11 - Life points. When it falls to < Â½ skill penalties are assessed. If it falls to 0 death occurs.
* Mana: 5 (6 base - 1 armor penalty) - Used by spell casting. Only refills during sleep or meditation.
* Defense: 7 - Proficiency enemies need to achieve to damage you.

## Skills

* Acrobatics (Rogue) Training in activities like dancing, contortion, climbing, tightrope walking, tumbling.
* Axes (Warrior) Training with axes and polearms
* Daggers (Rogue) Training with daggers and knives.

## Talents

* Massive Attack: You can add your Warrior level to your melee attack damage once per combat.

## Spells

* Frost Burn, Mana: 1, Difficulty: Easy, Touch. 1d6-2 damage. Mana burn raises damage by +1.
* Healing Hand, Mana: 1, Difficulty: Easy, Touch. 1d6 HP healed. Mana burn raises heal by +1.

## Equipment

* Adventurer's Kit: Flint and tinder. Water flask. Blanket. Bed roll. Small tent.
* Backpack
* Clothing Common
* Clothing Travel
* Iron Rations 1 week
* Pickaxe
* Rations 1 week
* Rope 30 feet
* Spellbook: Lose this and you can't cast spells until you locate another.
* Torches: 3 each
!torches= 3  #- @torches: 3 -#

!player.equipment.append(Item("Flint and tinder"))
!player.equipment.append(Item("Water flask"))
!player.equipment.append(Item("Blanket"))
!player.equipment.append(Item("Bed roll"))
!player.equipment.append(Item("Small tent"))
!player.equipment.append(Item("Backpack"))
!player.equipment.append(Item("Travel clothing"))
!player.equipment.append(Item("Iron rations 1 week"))
!player.equipment.append(Item("Pickaxe"))
!player.equipment.append(Item("Normal rations 1 week"))
!player.equipment.append(Item("Rope, 30ft"))
!player.equipment.append(Item("Spellbook"))
!player.equipment.append(Item("Torch"))
!player.equipment.append(Item("Torch"))
!player.equipment.append(Item("Torch"))

## Money

* SP: 122

!player.equipment.append(Item("SP: 122"))

## Weapons

Axe (Axes) [1d6]

!player.weapons.clear()

;## Axe (+0/+0).

## Armor
!player.armor # 5
!player.armor_penalty # 4
Chain, Defense: +5, Mana: -4

!player.armor_worn.clear()
!player.equip_armor(Armor.by_name("Chain")) # Total defense: 12, Mana Penalty: 4, Mana: 2
;## Total defense: 12, Mana Penalty: 4, Mana: 2

!location= "outside" # @location: "outside"

Atop of the hill stand the ruins of what was once an abbey. Legend has it that
long ago the studious monks became corrupted by some evil and were destroyed by
a band of wizards.

As a new adventurer you have come seeking loot. Hopefully stuff that will help
with future adventures, or at least enough money to get a meal and room at a
decent inn.

You walk up the hill to the ruins.

Digging through the rumble you happen upon a flight of stairs leading down
underground.

!location= "1" # @location: "stairs down 1"
!room=rooms(location)
!room # 
;## ROOM: 1 (1)
;## a flight of stairs and come to a short 10ft passageway which ends at a
;## wall with an opening to another flight of stairs heading down into
;## darkness.

You walk down a flight of stairs and come to a short 10ft passageway which ends
at a wall with an opening to another flight of stairs heading down into
darkness.

!torches= 2 # @torches: torches - 1
!player.equipment_list #

;## Torch (#2)
;## Torch (#3)
;## SP: 122 (#1)

You light a torch and enter the passageway turning to the right and follow the
stairs down a landing which leads straight ahead to another set of stairs going
down. You follow those stairs down and walk through a short passageway that
makes a right turn into a much longer passageway disappearing into darkness.

; (False, '') # @wander()

!location # 1
!location= "4way" # @location: "4 way facing w"
!room=rooms(location)
!room # 
;## ROOM: 4way (1)
;## A four way intersection. E is where you came in. N, S, W disappear
;## into darkness.

You stop and listening carefully before proceeding. You only hear your own
breathing. Deciding there is nothing waiting to attack you in the darkess beyond
the reach of the torch light you continue on.

You follow the passage for 60ft and come to a four way intersection. The
passages left, straight ahead, and right disappear into darkness.

!location= "4" # @location: "cave 4 entrance w"
!room=rooms(location)
!room # 
;## ROOM: 4 (1)
;## a natural cave. Water oozes down the walls and forms a 30ft diameter
;## pond in the middle of it. You notice water dripping from the cave roof
;## about 30ft above. From the pond a rivulet of water heads into a large
;## crack in the middle of the left wall which appears large enough to
;## walk into. The pond is covered in what appears to be a dark green
;## scummy algae.
;## 1d3 Giant Spiders in crack. Will attack if pond is searched and looted.

You cross the intersection and enter the passageway in front of you. You walk
for 60ft and come to an opening into a large cave.

Water oozes down the walls of this natural cave and forms a 30ft diameter pond
in the middle of it. You notice water dripping from the cave roof about 30ft
above. From the pond a rivulet of water heads into the crack which appears large
enough to walk into. The pond is covered in what appears to be a dark green
scummy algae.

:Enter cave and examine pond.|a9856a35
:Enter cave and explore crack.|714ae059

;## ROOM: 5 (1)
;## You come to a portcullis. Beyond you see a 90ft x 40ft room with
;## alcoves in the walls. You can't see into the alcoves from here. You
;## push the portcullis open with the sound of rusted screeching metal and
;## step into the room. You can now see into the alcoves and notice they
;## are filled with the skeletons and corpses of monks, except one in the
;## right wall in the near corner.
;## 1d3 Skeletons, 1d4 Zombies

You follow the passage and come to a closed portcullis. Looking through the
bars you see a 90ft x 40ft room with alcoves in all the walls. From here you
cannot see into the alcoves as their contents are shrouded in darkness.

You follow this passageway for 60ft and come to a three way intersection with
openings to your left and straight ahead. The passageway to your left disappears
into darkness. The passageway ahead of you goes for 10ft past the intersection
and ends at a set of stairs heading down.

!location= "2" # @location: "2"
!room=rooms(location)
!room # 
;## ROOM: 2 (1)
;## You follow the passage for 50ft and come to a cave with a tiled floor.
;## You see a stone plynth on the far side holding a two handed war axe.
;## Even from this distance you can tell that it is a finely crafted
;## weapon. Next to the plynth on the floor you see the remains of a monk
;## with several arrows in its back. It looks like the monk was trying to
;## reach the axe before being struck down. As you look beyond the dead
;## monk you see figures moving into the torchlight.
;## Dead monk with arrows in back next to plynth. Axe on plynth. 1d3 skeletons. 1d4 zombies.

You follow the passage for 50ft and come to a cave with a tiled floor. You see
a stone plynth on the far side holding a two handed war axe. Even from this
distance you can tell that it is a finely crafted weapon. Next to the plynth on
the floor you see the remains of a monk with several arrows in its back. It
looks like the monk was trying to reach the axe before being struck down. As you
look beyond the dead monk you see figures moving into the torchlight.

!qty_skel= 3 # @qty_skel: roll("1d3")
!qty_zomb= 3 # @qty_zomb: roll("1d4")
!skel1=NPC.skeleton_warrior()
!skel2=NPC.skeleton_warrior()
!skel3=NPC.skeleton_warrior()
!zomb1=NPC.zombie();
!zomb2=NPC.zombie();
!zomb3=NPC.zombie();

You see three skeleton warriors and three zombies come into view.

:Take axe.|5e3a7737

busted open. You don't see any doors or passages in the room.

!qty= 1 # @qty: roll("1d2")

!zomb1 = NPC.zombie()

!room # 
;## ROOM: 3 (2)
;## room of broken casks
;## 1 giant rats, 1 zombie

; "" # @'' if turn % 20 != 0 else 'Torch starts guttering'

You search about the room peering into the corners and at the casks. Suddenly
one of the casks on your left shifts and you hear a moaning sound. You see a
zombie stumble into the torch light. As you prepare to fight the zombie another
cask shifts, and you see the glowing red eyes of a giant rat staring out at you.

;;; !player.run_combat4([zomb1, rat])

; PC party has initiative
; Player hits Zombie (23) for 3 points of damage
; Player hits Zombie (23) for 4 points of damage
; Player hits for 5 points and Zombie (23) dies
; Player hits Giant Rat (16) for 4 points of damage
; Player hits Giant Rat (16) for 7 points of damage
; Giant Rat (16) hits Player for 2 points of damage
; Player hits for 1 points and Giant Rat (16) dies

See the two opponents, you decide to take care of the zombie first. With three
quick strikes, down, up, down it is done for and falls to the ground inert. You
lean sideways as the rat leaps toward you and put a few quick hacks into it
before it manages to leave a scratch down one of your arms. With a final chop,
you end its life.

!room.notes = "1 dead zombie. 1 dead giant rat."

;NPC party perished

;Zombie (23) hit points = 0
!del zomb1
;Giant Rat (16) hit points = 0
!del rat

;Player hit points = 9
!player.hp = 9

!player.equipment.append(Item("Longbow +1/+1", "backpack"))

You continue searching the room and find a very nice longbow tucked up
underneath some casks. While not directly useful, it may fetch some decent
silver at the weaponsmith's.

You find nothing else of interest.

;## ROOM: 2 (1)
;## You follow the passage for 50ft and come to a cave with a tiled floor.
;## You see a stone plynth on the far side holding a two handed war axe.
;## Even from this distance you can tell that it is a finely crafted

;## monk you see figures moving into the torchlight.

You follow the passage for 50ft and come to a cave with a tiled floor. You see
a stone plynth on the far side holding a two handed war axe. Even from this
distance you can tell that it is a finely crafted weapon. Next to the plynth on
the floor you see the remains of a monk with several arrows in its back. It
looks like the monk was trying to reach the axe before being struck down. As you
look beyond the dead monk you see figures moving into the torchlight.

!qty= 2 # @qty: roll("1d3")
!qty= 2 # @qty: roll("1d4")
!skel1 = NPC.skeleton_archer()
!skel2 = NPC.skeleton_archer()
!shots_left = 10
!zomb1 = NPC.zombie()
!zomb2 = NPC.zombie()

You see two zombies rushing at you and two skeleton archers taking aim!

;Skeleton Archer (#4) hit points = 9

;Zombie (#36) hit points = 12
!zomb2.hp = 12
;Player hit points = 10

The skeletons take aim and loose two bolts. One bounces off harmlessly but the
second is a lucky strike and pierces your left shoulder at your armor's seem. It
doesn't go deep though and falls away leaving a shallow gash.

!shots_left= 8 # @shots_left: shots_left - 1

FATE - 1. FATE POINTS REMAINING: 1

An arrow shot from a skeleton looks perfectly aimed to strike you in the face
when a zombie shifts in front of the bolt and blocks it from hitting you. The
zombie collapses to the floor. You rush the skeletons one by one to kill them
before they kill you.

!zomb2.hp= 0 # @zomb2.hp: skel1.damage_opponent(zomb2)

;win

You quickly end the two skeletal threats with one fatal strike each.

Setting the torch aside on the plynth, you pick up the two handed war axe.
Suddenly everything in the room seems brighter than before. Looking about you
notice that you can see into places where the torch light does not reach. Yes!
It's an enchanted weapon which grants dark sight!

You continue 60 ft and come to a natural cave. Water oozes down the walls and
forms a 30ft diameter pond in the middle of it. You notice water dripping from
the cave roof about 30ft above. From the pond a rivulet of water heads into a
large crack in the middle of the left wall which appears large enough to walk
into. The pond is covered in what appears to be a dark green scummy algae.

You follow the passage for 50ft and come to a cave with a tiled floor. You see
a stone plynth on the far side holding a two handed war axe. Even from this
distance you can tell that it is a finely crafted weapon. Next to the plynth on
the floor you see the remains of a monk with several arrows in its back. It
looks like the monk was trying to reach the axe before being struck down. As you
look beyond the dead monk you see figures moving into the torchlight from all
directions.

; Player (HP: 3, XP: 0) hits Zombie (#8) (HP: 3, XP: 0) for 9 points of damage
; Zombie (#8) (HP: 3, XP: 0) hits Player (HP: 2, XP: 0) for 1 points of damage
; Zombie (#7) (HP: 12, XP: 0) hits for 2 points and kills Player (HP: 0, XP: 0)

;Zombie (#8) (HP: 3, XP: 0) hit points = 3
;Zombie (#7) (HP: 12, XP: 0) hit points = 12
;Player (HP: 0, XP: 0) hit points = 0

The zombies rush you. You strike out hitting the first one for 9 points of
damage. They retaliate and hit you for three points. You collapse unmoving to
the floor. A moment later you corpse rises up as a zombie.

; 1 # @roll("1d6")

You have perished.

You discover a cleverly disguised door. Opening it up you step into a 40ft x
30ft room. All the walls are covered with depictions of evil and bloody looking
acts. On the far E wall you see a mummified corpse that is tied with barbed wire
to a wooden X. There is a small open chest in the far corner of the room to your
left.

; "Ring of Protection, BASE ARMOR +1" # @loot()
!room.add_item(Item("Ring of Protection, Armor +1")) #
;## 

Stepping over to the chest and peering in you see the chest is empty except for
a lone ring in one of the corners. Probably missed by whoever looted the chest
previously. Picking the ring up and examining it you see it is plainly crafted,
though of obvious high quality. You discover the etching of a shield on the
inner side of the ring.

:Equip ring.|8ce3c7b0
:Stow in backup to sell later.|23fabf36

FATE - 1. NO FATE POINTS REMAINING.

; ; Dark Power Intervention (3).

The undead horde rushes towards you. They will surely to overwhelm you in
moments. Suddenly you find that you can't move. The undead horde has stopped
advancing and seem frozen motionless.

Before you appears a two-handed axe dripping with blood and a voice booms out:

"Ah! Entertainment! Agree to do a task for me and have a chance to live. Refuse
and you most certainly will die.  There is an amulet secreted away on a shadow
plane where locations from this reality show up in that reality.  Retrieving
this amulet then escaping the complex will result in your life being spared.
After obtaining the amulet, take it to a place of my choosing for a reward
beyond just your life."

;## ---> PLAYER IS DEAD <---

!player.weapon # Axe (Dark Enchanted) (+1/+1). Two-handed. (Axes) [+1/attack, 2d6x+1/damage]

Rushing forwards you wade into the creatures and start laying waste with your
two-handed axe. Ichor flies everywhere coating everything around you as you chop
open one beetle after another. During the melee two of the beasts get past your
guard and bite for a total of three points of damage.

Looking at the mess, you count carcasses. You killed eight giant beetles.

Casting about the room you find nothing else of interest.

corpses here. One of a zombie. The other of a giant rat.

!player.hp= 7 # @player.hp: player.hp + hp

You notice movement on the stairs. You see three skeletons carrying short
swords entering the room.

!room.npc("Skeleton Warrior (#9)").hp=0 # ; Player (HP: 7, XP: 0) hits for 9 points and Skeleton Warrior (#9) (HP: 0, XP: 0) dies
!room.npc("Skeleton Warrior (#10)").hp=8 # ; Player (HP: 7, XP: 0) hits Skeleton Warrior (#10) (HP: 8, XP: 0) for 1 points of damage
!room.npc("Skeleton Warrior (#10)").hp=6 # ; Player (HP: 7, XP: 0) hits Skeleton Warrior (#10) (HP: 6, XP: 0) for 2 points of damage
!room.npc("Skeleton Warrior (#8)").hp=5 # ; Player (HP: 7, XP: 0) hits Skeleton Warrior (#8) (HP: 5, XP: 0) for 4 points of damage
!room.npc("Skeleton Warrior (#8)").hp=0 # ; Player (HP: 7, XP: 0) hits for 5 points and Skeleton Warrior (#8) (HP: 0, XP: 0) dies
!room.npc("Skeleton Warrior (#10)").hp=4 # ; Player (HP: 7, XP: 0) hits Skeleton Warrior (#10) (HP: 4, XP: 0) for 2 points of damage

!room.npc("Skeleton Warrior (#8)").hp = 0
!room.npc("Skeleton Warrior (#10)").hp = 4
!room.npc("Skeleton Warrior (#9)").hp = 0
!player.hp= 0 # @player.hp: 0

You lay into the skeletons with all your might.

Using your massive attack talent you strike the closes skeleton for 9 points
and it drops unmoving to the floor. Using fancy footwork you dance about the
remaining two skeletons and deliver multiple strikes. A second skeleton drops.
You strike the last skeleton and you fail to dodge its return strike. It stabs
you for 7 points of damage. You feel the fight leave you as the axe clatters to
the floor, with you immediately following after.

You have perished.

very one sided battle ensues. The spiders quickly stab out with their forelegs,
each one quickly dragging a weasel within biting range, where they immediately
shove their fangs in a inject venom.

In short order the weasels are motionless. The spiders begin adding them to
their larder.

!room.notes=""

You step into the pond and grope around feeling along its rough bottom. When
you reach the center you notice the texture suddenly becomes very smooth.
Feeling around a little more you find an edge you can pull up on. You pull up on
the edge and a large metal plate comes to the surface in your grasp. You toss
the plate aside and feel down where it was. You find a shallow depression with a
heavy sack in it. You drag the sack out to lie next to the pond. As you prepare
to open the sack, you notice kobolds pouring into the cave from the entrance.

;## room of broken casks
;## 1 dead zombie. 1 dead giant rat. Looted.

;;; !player.cast("Healing Hand")

!player.mana=1
!hp= 3 # @hp: roll("1d6")

;;; !player.cast("Healing Hand")
; Cast succeeded. Healing Hand: Touch. 1d6 HP healed. Mana burn raises heal by +1.
!player.mana=0

!hp= 3 # @hp: roll("1d6")
!player.hp= 8 # @player.hp: player.hp + hp

Exhausting your mana, you cast Healing Hand twice to regain 6 points of health.

You are sure it won't be long before the rats or something worse comes down the
stairs, and you would have no way out.

!facing= "n" # @facing: "n"

!room=rooms(location)
!room # 
;## ROOM: 3way (5)
;## You are at a three way. E, N, S. S is stairs heading down.
;##
;## [1] Giant Rat (#2) (HP: 12, XP: 0)
;## [2] Giant Rat (#3) (HP: 12, XP: 0)
;## [3] Giant Rat (#4) (HP: 12, XP: 0)
;## [4] Giant Rat (#5) (HP: 12, XP: 0)
;## [5] Giant Rat (#6) (HP: 12, XP: 0)

;;; !player.run_combat(room.npcs)

; PC party has initiative
!player.massive_attack=False # ; Player (HP: 8, XP: 0) uses talent massive attack
!room.npc("Giant Rat (#2)").hp=6 # ; Player (HP: 8, XP: 0) hits Giant Rat (#2) (HP: 6, XP: 0) for 6 points of damage
!room.npc("Giant Rat (#5)").hp=2 # ; Player (HP: 8, XP: 0) hits Giant Rat (#5) (HP: 2, XP: 0) for 10 points of damage
!player.hp = 6 # ; Giant Rat (#2) (HP: 6, XP: 0) hits Player (HP: 6, XP: 0) for 2 points of damage
!room.npc("Giant Rat (#2)").hp=5 # ; Player (HP: 6, XP: 0) hits Giant Rat (#2) (HP: 5, XP: 0) for 1 points of damage
!player.hp = 3 # ; Giant Rat (#3) (HP: 12, XP: 0) hits Player (HP: 3, XP: 0) for 3 points of damage
!player.hp = 1 # ; Giant Rat (#6) (HP: 12, XP: 0) hits Player (HP: 1, XP: 0) for 2 points of damage
!room.npc("Giant Rat (#2)").hp=4 # ; Player (HP: 1, XP: 0) hits Giant Rat (#2) (HP: 4, XP: 0) for 1 points of damage
!room.npc("Giant Rat (#5)").hp=0 # ; Player (HP: 1, XP: 0) hits for 2 points and Giant Rat (#5) (HP: 0, XP: 0) dies
!room.npc("Giant Rat (#4)").hp=11 # ; Player (HP: 1, XP: 0) hits Giant Rat (#4) (HP: 11, XP: 0) for 1 points of damage
!player.hp = 0 # ; Giant Rat (#3) (HP: 12, XP: 0) hits for 1 points and kills Player (HP: 0, XP: 0)

; Giant Rat (#2) (HP: 4, XP: 0)
; Giant Rat (#3) (HP: 12, XP: 0)
; Giant Rat (#4) (HP: 11, XP: 0)
; DEAD: Giant Rat (#5) (HP: 0, XP: 0)
; Giant Rat (#6) (HP: 12, XP: 0)
; DEAD: Player (HP: 0, XP: 0)

You run up the stairs and rush the rats with your axe upraised.

You hit first giant rat for 6 points of damage, dodge the rat's return attack,
then hit the third rat for 10 points of damage.

The first rat gets past your defenses and hits you for 2 points of damage.

You strike the first rat again for another point of damage.

The second and fourth rats get past your defenses and hit you for a total of 4
points of damage.

You strike out and hit the first rat for 1 point of damage with a follow up
strike against the fourth rat for two points of damage. The fourth rat drops,
twitching, to the floor.

You manage to hit the third rat for one point of damage before the second rat
gets past your defenses and hits. Your health is gone. You drop as the rats
swarm over you.

You have perished.

;## ---> PLAYER IS DEAD <---

;## ROOM: 4way (3)
;## Four way intersection. E is dungeon entrance.
;##
;## [1] Goblin Warrior (#1) (HP: 8, XP: 50)
;## [2] Goblin Warrior (#2) (HP: 8, XP: 50)
;## [3] Goblin Warrior (#3) (HP: 8, XP: 50)

You reach the 4-way intersection. You haven't been down the left passage. The
passage straight ahead across the intersection leads to the room with the
portcullis. The passage to the right leads to the entrance of the complex.

Three goblin warriors step out of the passage to your right and rush forwards
to attack!

;;; !player.run_combat(room.npcs)

; PC party has initiative
!player.massive_attack=False # ; Player uses talent massive attack
!room.npc("Goblin Warrior (#1)").hp=0 # ; Player hits for 8 points and Goblin Warrior (#1) dies
!room.npc("Goblin Warrior (#2)").hp=4 # ; Player hits Goblin Warrior (#2) (HP: 4, XP: 50) for 4 points of damage
!room.npc("Goblin Warrior (#3)").hp=6 # ; Player hits Goblin Warrior (#3) (HP: 6, XP: 50) for 2 points of damage
!room.npc("Goblin Warrior (#2)").hp=2 # ; Player hits Goblin Warrior (#2) (HP: 2, XP: 50) for 2 points of damage
!room.npc("Goblin Warrior (#3)").hp=3 # ; Player hits Goblin Warrior (#3) (HP: 3, XP: 50) for 3 points of damage
!room.npc("Goblin Warrior (#2)").hp=0 # ; Player hits for 2 points and Goblin Warrior (#2) dies
!room.npc("Goblin Warrior (#3)").hp=0 # ; Player hits for 3 points and Goblin Warrior (#3) dies

; DEAD: Goblin Warrior (#1)
; DEAD: Goblin Warrior (#2)
; DEAD: Goblin Warrior (#3)
; Player

Using your massive attack talent, you strike the first goblin for 8 points of
damage, killing it instantly. You expertly dodge their return strikes between
each of your strikes. You strike the second goblin for 4 points, again for 2
points, and finally for another 2 points killing it. You continue expertly
dodging return strikes. You strike the third goblin for 2 points, again for 3
points, and finally for another 3 points killing it.

The longer you are here, the busier the place seems to be getting! Almost like
someone is sending the monsters out to kill you!

;## ROOM: 4 (1)
;## a natural cave. Water oozes down the walls and forms a 30ft diameter
;## pond in the middle of it. You notice water dripping from the cave roof
;## about 30ft above. From the pond a rivulet of water heads into a large
;## crack in the middle of the left wall which appears large enough to
;## walk into. The pond is covered in what appears to be a dark green
;## scummy algae.
;##
;## [1] Goblin Warrior (#4) (HP: 8, XP: 50)
;## [2] Goblin Warrior (#5) (HP: 8, XP: 50)
;## [3] Goblin Warrior (#6) (HP: 8, XP: 50)
;## [4] Goblin Warrior (#7) (HP: 8, XP: 50)
;## 1d3 Giant Spiders in crack. Will attack if pond is searched and looted.
You go down a 60 ft passage and come to a natural cave. Water oozes down the
walls and forms a 30ft diameter pond in the middle of it. You notice water
dripping from the cave roof about 30ft above. From the pond a rivulet of water
heads into a large crack in the middle of the left wall which appears large
enough to walk into. The pond is covered in what appears to be a dark green
# scummy algae.

Four goblin warriors approach you with weapons at the ready. The seem to gaze
upon like you would yourself upon seeing a fantastic meal. You prepare to fight.

!qty= 7 # @qty: roll("3d3")
;;; !7 rooms("4a").add_item(NPC.giant_spider())
!rooms("4a").add_item(NPC.giant_spider()) #
;## 
!rooms("4a").add_item(NPC.giant_spider()) #
;## 
!rooms("4a").add_item(NPC.giant_spider()) #
;## 
!rooms("4a").add_item(NPC.giant_spider()) #
;## 
!rooms("4a").add_item(NPC.giant_spider()) #
;## 
!rooms("4a").add_item(NPC.giant_spider()) #
;## 
!rooms("4a").add_item(NPC.giant_spider()) #
;## 

!player.massive_attack = True
;;; !player.run_combat(room.npcs)

; PC party has initiative
!player.massive_attack=False # ; Player uses talent massive attack
!room.npc("Goblin Warrior (#7)").hp=1 # ; Player hits Goblin Warrior (#7) (HP: 1, XP: 50) for 7 points of damage
!room.npc("Goblin Warrior (#6)").hp=4 # ; Player hits Goblin Warrior (#6) (HP: 4, XP: 50) for 4 points of damage
!room.npc("Goblin Warrior (#4)").hp=4 # ; Player hits Goblin Warrior (#4) (HP: 4, XP: 50) for 4 points of damage
!room.npc("Goblin Warrior (#7)").hp=0 # ; Player hits for 1 points and Goblin Warrior (#7) dies
!room.npc("Goblin Warrior (#4)").hp=1 # ; Player hits Goblin Warrior (#4) (HP: 1, XP: 50) for 3 points of damage
!room.npc("Goblin Warrior (#6)").hp=3 # ; Player hits Goblin Warrior (#6) (HP: 3, XP: 50) for 1 points of damage
!player.hp = 4 # ; Goblin Warrior (#5) hits Player for 4 points of damage
!room.npc("Goblin Warrior (#4)").hp=0 # ; Player hits for 1 points and Goblin Warrior (#4) dies
!player.hp = 1 # ; Goblin Warrior (#5) hits Player for 3 points of damage
!room.npc("Goblin Warrior (#6)").hp=0 # ; Player hits for 3 points and Goblin Warrior (#6) dies
!player.hp = 0 # ; Goblin Warrior (#5) hits for 1 points and kills Player

; DEAD: Goblin Warrior (#4)
; Goblin Warrior (#5)
; DEAD: Goblin Warrior (#6)
; DEAD: Goblin Warrior (#7)
; DEAD: Player

You strike quick and hard dealing damage two of the goblins while dodging blows
and kill a third. One goblin, hanging back, strikes between its companions
hitting you for 4 points of damage. Ouch. You finish off another goblin just
before the one hanging back manages to hit you with a death blow.

You have perished.

You wait as they rush forwards, then lay waste to the kobolds as they enter the
shallow pond. They strike out with ineffective blows against you, as you wield
your two-handed axe like a scithe mowing down wheat. Every strike made is a
kobold dead.

Well, that didn't take long.

This place does seem to be getting busier and busier with monsters.

You dump the sack out and find a set of finely crafted chain mail. You detect
no signs of rust even though it has been submerged for an unknown period of
time.

out four times with your axe dealing damage to four goblins doling out 7 points,
6 points, 4 points, and 5 points of damage. One of the goblins then manages to
get past your defense and hits you for 3 points of damage. Striking out twice
more in quick succession you kill two of the goblins.

!room.desc1  # You come to a portcullis. Beyond you see a 90ft x 40ft room with alcoves in the walls. You can't see into the alcoves from here. ;## You come to a portcullis. Beyond you see a 90ft x 40ft room with alcoves in the walls. You can't see into the alcoves from here. You push the portcullis open with the sound of rusted screeching metal and step into the room. You can now see into the alcoves and notice they are filled with the skeletons and corpses of monks, except one in the right wall in the near corner.

look beyond the dead monk you see figures moving into the torchlight.

weasels gets past your defenses hitting you for 3 points, sapping the last of
your health. You collapse and the weasels take to feasting.

You have perished.

;## You come to a portcullis. Beyond you see a 90ft x 40ft room with alcoves in the walls. You can't see into the alcoves from here. You rush by the weasels in such a hurry that you leave them looking stunned in
your wake.

You come to an open portcullis leading into a 90ft x 40ft room with alcoves in
the walls. You notice the alcoves are filled with the skeletons and corpses of
monks. Though the biggest attention getter is the pack of worgs munching bones
in the alcoves. As a group, they turn to face you. In there eyes you can see
them thinking, "Fresh Meat!"

You are seriously injured and have no mana.

walls. You can't see into the alcoves from here. You push the portcullis open
with the sound of rusted screeching metal and step into the room. You can now
see into the alcoves and notice they are filled with the skeletons and corpses
of monks, except one in the right wall in the near corner. You hear growling and
snuffling noises coming from the entrance. Turning to look you see the room is
starting to fill up with giant weasels!

you reach the center you notice the texture suddenly becomes very smooth.

the edge and a large metal plate comes to the surface in your grasp. You toss
the plate aside and feel down where it was. You find a shallow depression with a
sack in it.

;## ROOM: 5 (3)
;## Crypt of dead monks
;##
;## [1] Skeleton Warrior (#43) (HP: 9, XP: 0)
;## [2] Skeleton Warrior (#44) (HP: 9, XP: 0)
;## [3] Zombie (#67) (HP: 12, XP: 0)
;## [4] Zombie (#68) (HP: 12, XP: 0)
;## [5] Zombie (#69) (HP: 12, XP: 0)

As you start towards the nearest alcove its occupant rises up and raises a
short sword intending to kill you! Jumping back, you see several other occupants
stepping out of alcoves. You count two skeleton warriors and three zombies.

;;; !player.run_combat(room.npcs)

; PC party has initiative
!room.npc("Skeleton Warrior (#43)").hp=2 # ; Player hits Skeleton Warrior (#43) (HP: 2, XP: 0) for 7 points of damage
!room.npc("Zombie (#69)").hp=1 # ; Player hits Zombie (#69) (HP: 1, XP: 0) for 11 points of damage
!room.npc("Skeleton Warrior (#43)").hp=0 # ; Player hits for 2 points and Skeleton Warrior (#43) dies
!player.hp = 3 # ; Zombie (#68) hits Player for 3 points of damage
!room.npc("Skeleton Warrior (#44)").hp=8 # ; Player hits Skeleton Warrior (#44) (HP: 8, XP: 0) for 1 points of damage
!player.hp = 0 # ; Zombie (#68) hits for 3 points and kills Player

; DEAD: Skeleton Warrior (#43)
; Skeleton Warrior (#44)
; Zombie (#67)
; Zombie (#68)
; Zombie (#69)
; DEAD: Player

You hit the first skeleton for 7 points of damage. Avoiding return strikes you
hit a zombie for 11 points of damage. Dodging another set of strikes, you hit
the first skeleton a second time for 2 points of damage and it drops. As the
skeleton falls, a zombie gets past your defenses and hits you for 3 points of
damage, leaving you only 3 health left. Swinging you axe back around you hit the
second skeleton for a measly 1 point of damage when the zombie reaches in and
bites into your throat. Everything goes dark.

You are now a zombie.

;## ---> PLAYER IS DEAD <---

:Start Over.|start

You are spider fodder.

you reach the center you notice the texture suddenly becomes very smooth.

the edge and a large metal plate comes to the surface in your grasp. You toss
the plate aside and feel down where it was. You find a shallow depression with a
sack in it.

various states of being coccooned up.

Taking advantage of not being attacked, you cast Healing Hand on yourself.

!player.hp= 11 # @player.hp: player.hp + hp

efficiency. One of the buggers got you for four points of damage though.

You continue upslope and come to an opening. Peering out, you see the hillside
with the ruins of the abbey just above you.

You come to a portcullis. Beyond you see a 90ft x 40ft room with alcoves in the
walls. You can't see into the alcoves from here. You push the portcullis open
with the sound of rusted screeching metal and step into the room. You can now
see into the alcoves and notice they are filled with the skeletons and corpses
of monks, except one in the right wall in the near corner.

!player.equipment.append(room.pop_item("belt"))
!player.warrior_mod = 2
!player.reset_defense() # 14

You watch the spiders and worgs battle it out. It does not go well for the
worgs. Finally two giant spiders remain. Now is the time to attack!

;;; !player.run_combat(room.npc_group("spider"))

; NPC party has initiative
!player.hp = 4 # ; Giant Spider (#6) hits Player for 7 points of damage
!player.massive_attack=False # ; Player uses talent massive attack
!room.npc("Giant Spider (#6)").hp=9 # ; Player hits Giant Spider (#6) (HP: 9, XP: 0) for 6 points of damage
!room.npc("Giant Spider (#5)").hp=7 # ; Player hits Giant Spider (#5) (HP: 7, XP: 0) for 2 points of damage
!room.npc("Giant Spider (#6)").hp=8 # ; Player hits Giant Spider (#6) (HP: 8, XP: 0) for 1 points of damage
!room.npc("Giant Spider (#6)").hp=7 # ; Player hits Giant Spider (#6) (HP: 7, XP: 0) for 1 points of damage
!room.npc("Giant Spider (#5)").hp=0 # ; Player hits for 7 points and Giant Spider (#5) dies
!room.npc("Giant Spider (#6)").hp=6 # ; Player hits Giant Spider (#6) (HP: 6, XP: 0) for 1 points of damage
!room.npc("Giant Spider (#6)").hp=5 # ; Player hits Giant Spider (#6) (HP: 5, XP: 0) for 1 points of damage
!room.npc("Giant Spider (#6)").hp=4 # ; Player hits Giant Spider (#6) (HP: 4, XP: 0) for 1 points of damage
!room.npc("Giant Spider (#6)").hp=3 # ; Player hits Giant Spider (#6) (HP: 3, XP: 0) for 1 points of damage
!room.npc("Giant Spider (#6)").hp=2 # ; Player hits Giant Spider (#6) (HP: 2, XP: 0) for 1 points of damage
!room.npc("Giant Spider (#6)").hp=1 # ; Player hits Giant Spider (#6) (HP: 1, XP: 0) for 1 points of damage
!player.hp = 3 # ; Giant Spider (#6) hits Player for 1 points of damage
;!player.hp = 0 # ; Giant Spider (#6) hits for 3 points and kills Player

; DEAD: Giant Spider (#4)
; DEAD: Giant Spider (#5)
; Giant Spider (#6)
; DEAD: Player
!player.fate= 0 # @player.fate: 0

One of the spiders manages to hit before you fully get into ready position and
does a massive 7 points of damage. You return the favor by striking multiple
times against both creatures while dodging and weaving multiple attacks. -6, -2,
-1, -1, -7. One of the spiders collapses to the floor. Only one spider left. You
continue to evade attacks while dealing damage. You deal 6 points in a flurry of
strikes before the spider gets past your defenses and strikes you with a
forelimb for 1 point of damage.

FATE - 1. NO FATE POINTS REMAINING.

; Magical Scythe Blades appear then vanish. 4d10 dmg. (16)

You hear a click from the floor and suddenly see the flash of silvery metal as
ghostly scythe blades appear sweeping back and forth before vanishing into
nothingness.

!dmg= 17 # @dmg: roll("4d10")
!room.npc("#6").hp= -16 # @room.npc("#6").hp: room.npc("#6").hp - dmg

The last spider bursts splashing ichor everywhere. Its pieces fall unmoving to
the floor.

You are gravely wounded and take a moment to cast Healing Hand.

;;; !Macro.heal()

!cast= False # @cast: 'succeeded' in str(player.cast('Healing Hand')).lower()
!player.mana= 2 # @player.mana: player.mana
!hp= 0 # @hp: roll('1d6') if cast else 0
!player.hp= 3 # @player.hp: player.hp + hp

;;; !Macro.heal()

!cast= True # @cast: 'succeeded' in str(player.cast('Healing Hand')).lower()
!player.mana= 1 # @player.mana: player.mana
!hp= 6 # @hp: roll('1d6') if cast else 0
!player.hp= 9 # @player.hp: player.hp + hp

;;; !Macro.heal()

!cast= True # @cast: 'succeeded' in str(player.cast('Healing Hand')).lower()
!player.mana= 0 # @player.mana: player.mana
!hp= 6 # @hp: roll('1d6') if cast else 0
!player.hp= 15 # @player.hp: player.hp + hp

It takes three casts and the exhaustion of your mana, but you heal yourself
back to full strenth.

Searching about, you find nothing else of interest.

!room.npc("Zombie 6bc986b4 (#1)").hp=0 # ; Player hits for 2 points and Zombie 6bc986b4 (#1) dies

!room.npc("Skeleton Warrior 6bc986b4 (#2)").hp=0 # ; Player hits for 3 points and Skeleton Warrior 6bc986b4 (#2) dies
!room.npc("Zombie 6bc986b4 (#3)").hp=0 # ; Player hits for 1 points and Zombie 6bc986b4 (#3) dies

; DEAD: Skeleton Warrior 6bc986b4 (#1)
; DEAD: Skeleton Warrior 6bc986b4 (#2)
; DEAD: Skeleton Warrior 6bc986b4 (#3)
; DEAD: Zombie 6bc986b4 (#1)
; DEAD: Zombie 6bc986b4 (#2)
; DEAD: Zombie 6bc986b4 (#3)
; DEAD: Zombie 6bc986b4 (#4)
; Player

You lay into the undead horde hacking and slashing everywhere you can to end
the threat. You quickly vanquish two of the three skeletons and then start into
the zombies. After much hacking one of the zombies drops allowing you to get
another strike into the last skeleton. As you do so, one of the zombies manages
to reach in with its clawed hands piercing your armor. -2 HP. You continue
waving your axe about in a frantic way and shortly two more zombies drop to the
floor unmoving. Another of the zombies gets past your defense and pierces your
armor. -4 HP. You finish off the remaining undead with two strikes against the
last zombie and one final hit against the last skeleton.

Looking about you see three dead skeleton warriors and four dead zombies.

You are badly injured.

; "Keoghtom's Ointment, doses: 3, heals 2d8+2" # @loot()
!room.add_item(Item("Keoghtom's Ointment, heals 2d8+2")) #
;## 
!room.item("Keoghtom's Ointment").uses = 3

Quickly searching the bodies and alcoves you find a tin of salve in one of the
zombie pockets. Opening it up and looking inside you see what looks like 3 doses
left of what might be a healing salve.

;## ---> PLAYER IS BADLY INJURED AND NEEDS HEALING <---

!room.npc("Zombie (#82)").hp=2 # ; Player hits Zombie (#82) (HP: 2, XP: 50) for 6 points of damage
!player.hp = 4 # ; Skeleton Warrior (#57) hits Player for 5 points of damage
!room.npc("Zombie (#85)").hp=4 # ; Player hits Zombie (#85) (HP: 4, XP: 50) for 4 points of damage

!room.npc("Zombie (#85)").hp=0 # ; Player hits for 4 points and Zombie (#85) dies
!room.npc("Zombie (#84)").hp=1 # ; Player hits Zombie (#84) (HP: 1, XP: 50) for 4 points of damage

!room.npc("Zombie (#82)").hp=1 # ; Player hits Zombie (#82) (HP: 1, XP: 50) for 1 points of damage

!room.npc("Zombie (#82)").hp=0 # ; Player hits for 1 points and Zombie (#82) dies
!room.npc("Skeleton Warrior (#56)").hp=4 # ; Player hits Skeleton Warrior (#56) (HP: 4, XP: 50) for 5 points of damage

; DEAD: Skeleton Warrior (#56)
; DEAD: Skeleton Warrior (#57)
; DEAD: Zombie (#82)
; DEAD: Zombie (#83)
; DEAD: Zombie (#84)
; DEAD: Zombie (#85)
; Player

You rush in to do battle.

You are bit by a zombie. -2 HP. You strike down a zombie. -8 HP. You leave a
long gash in another. -6 HP. One of the skeletons gets past your defense and
stabs you. -5 HP. You strike the two remaing zombies again. -4 HP. -3 HP. One of
them successfully retaliates for a clawed hand strike. -3 HP.

Girding your self as you weaken you continue dealing blow after blow. You drop
two more zombies. -4 HP. -1 HP. -1 HP.

Swinging your axe around you deal fatal damage to one of the skeleton warriors.
-9 HP. On your return swing you hit another zombie causing it to fall. -1 HP.

Only the one skeleton left.

You quickly dispatch it with two well placed strikes. -5 HP. -4 HP.

Taking stock, you realize that you are now gravely wounded.

You look the axe over:

!player.weapon.description # 
;## Axe (Dark Enchanted) (+1/+1). Two-handed.
;## 
;## The blades are a solid black with red etchings following along their cutting edges.
;## The hand grip is wrapped in a black leather that is stamped with dark blood red arcane symbols.
;## The top of the hand grip has a circle of dark blood red leather as does the bottom of the hand grip.
;## From the edge of the hasp dangles a dark blood red leather strip loop.
;## Attack Bonus: +1, Damage Bonus: +1, Grants dark sight 60ft.
;## The blade edges become wreathed in flame when attacking. The +1 effects are from the flames. 
;## 
The blades are a solid black with red etchings following along their cutting
edges. The hand grip is wrapped in a black leather that is stamped with dark
blood red arcane symbols. The top of the hand grip has a circle of dark blood
red leather as does the bottom of the hand grip. From the edge of the hasp
dangles a dark blood red leather strip loop.

sputter out but that you can see better than before. Ah! The axe grants
darkvision! Fantastic!

Looking about there is nothing else other than the bodies of the undead and the
stone plynth.

;## Torch (#2)
;## Torch (#3)
;## SP: 122 (#1)

; "Ring of Protection, BASE ARMOR +1" # @loot()
; "Gauntlets of Ogre Power, WARRIOR +3" # @loot()
!player.equipment.append(Item("Ring of Protection +1", "right hand f1"))
!player.equipment.append(Item("Gauntlets of Ogre Power, W+3", "both forearms"))

Pulling up on the edge of what you can now tell is some sort of metal plate you
grope around under it and find a medium sack.

Emptying the sack out you find a ring and a set of gauntlets. The ring has a
picture of a shield engraved on its inner ring. The guantlets are nicely
decorated and each one has an engraving of a fist.

You suddenly hear hissing coming from the doorway out of the cave. Looking over
quickly you see a giant spider approaching.

!location= "4" # @location: location + " - ring defense +1, ogre gauntlets w+3, giant spider"
!room=rooms(location)
!room.notes = "facing 1 giant spider. have loot."

suddenly attack each other! They must really want to claim you as a kill if they
are fighting over you!

;;; !skel1.run_combat4([skel2])

; PC party has initiative

;Skeleton Warrior (19) hit points = 0

;Skeleton Warrior (18) hit points = 4
!skel1.hp = 4

You see one of the skeletons strike chipping bone off the other. The second
retaliates by crushing the head of the first skeleton with the pommel of its
sword. The first skeleton drops into a heap of bones on the floor. The second
skeleton advances.

;;; !player.run_combat4([skel1])

; NPC party has initiative
; Player hits for 4 points and Skeleton Warrior (18) dies

;NPC party perished

;Skeleton Warrior (18) hit points = 0

You come to a small closed portcullis. Beyond it you see alcoves in the walls
everywhere you can see.

You push up on the portcullis. It gives way grudgingly with a loud screech. It
must not have been opended for a long time. It suddenly moves upwards and stops
with a bang.

You step into the room and notice that there is movement in several of the
alcoves!

With mounting horror you realize you've entered a crypt and it seems to be full
of the undead! If you turn to flee you know they will quickly catch up and
overwhelm you. Better to stand and fight at the entrace. Keep how many can
attack you at once down to one at a time.

You stand valiantly against the onslaught, dealing out damage left and right in
a whirlwind of axe strikes.

Using your massive attack talent, you strike the first skeleton for 9 points
flinging it back against the wall where it collapses into a disjoint pile of
bones and rusty armor.

You swipe the first zombie twice, cutting deeply into its chest. I crumples
into a heap on the floor.

The remaining zombies crowd in a against you, you manage to strike into the
mass of stinking flesh and deal 6 points of damage against the first zombie, 2
points of damage against another another with a double strike, and 11 points
against the third.

The first zombie rakes its clawed hands across your chest getting past your
armor and dealing 2 points of damage.

You strike back it at for 1 point of damage and follow through with a
successful strike against another of the things. It drops.

Two zombies and one skeleton warrior to go!

One of the zombies reaches in and manages to bite you with its stinking maw for
8 points of damage. Ouch, that hurt!

While strike it for 2 points of damage in retaliation the skeletons finally
reach you and stab in with their rusty short swords piercing you armor and
striking you down.

grasp. You toss the plate aside and feel down where it was. You find a shallow
depression with a sack in it.

that it is finely made. You've seen bags similar to this in magic shops, their
insides are bigger than their outsides.

You put the bag on your belt. It will work better than the backpack for
stashing loot.

Looking about you see nothing else of interest.

;## ROOM: 2 (1)
;## You follow the passage for 50ft and come to a cave with a tiled floor.

You follow the passage for 50ft and come to a cave with a tiled floor. You see
a stone plynth on the far side holding a two handed war axe. Even from this
distance you can tell that it is a finely crafted weapon. Next to the plynth on
the floor you see the remains of a monk with several arrows in its back. It
looks like the monk was trying to reach the axe before being struck down. As you
look beyond the dead monk you see figures moving into the torchlight.

!dark_axe=Weapon.by_name("Axe (Dark Enchanted)")

; 2 # @roll("1d3")
!skel1 = NPC.skeleton_archer().set_location(location)
!skel2 = NPC.skeleton_archer().set_location(location)
; 4 # @roll("1d4")
!zomb1 = NPC.zombie().set_location(location)
!zomb2 = NPC.zombie().set_location(location)
!zomb3 = NPC.zombie().set_location(location)
!zomb4 = NPC.zombie().set_location(location)
!shots_remaining= 10 # @shots_remaining: 10

You see four zombies rushing in to eat you and two skeleton archers taking aim.

!initiative = True

The archers' shots bounce harmlessly off your armor with plink sounds.

that gets close.

One of the zombies takes an arrow in the back of the head that would have

FATE - 1. NO FATE POINTS REMAINING.

The floor suddenly gives way beneath the remaining undead revealing a 10 ft
deep pit filled with spikes!

They are skewered by the sharp tips and cease their attempts to murder you.

covered with depictions of evil and bloody looking acts. On the far wall you see
a mummmified corpose that is tied with barbed wire to a wooden X.

Rushing forward you use your massive attack talent and destroy the skeleton in
one blow. You follow that up with two quick strikes on the first zombie,
severing its head and killing it. Swinging back around you slice a long gash
across the second zombie's chest dealing 4 points of damage.

rings.

talent you hit it for 15 points of damage following up with another quick chop
for 2 more points of damage.

of damage.

damage.

a stone plynth on the far side holding a two handed war axe. Even from this
distance you can tell that it is a finely crafted weapon. Next to the plynth on
the floor you see the remains of a monk with several arrows in its back. It
looks like the monk was trying to reach the axe before being struck down. As you
look beyond the dead monk you see figures moving into the torchlight.

and you most certainly will die. There is an amulet secreted away on a shadow
plane where locations from this reality show up in that reality. Retrieving this
amulet then escaping the complex will result in your life being spared. After
obtaining the amulet, take it to a place of my choosing for a reward beyond just
your life."

As you continue further into the room to get a better look at the casks and
anything they may be hiding you find yourself jumped by two giant rats. Taking
the initiative you swing the axe to great effect. You strike the first rat
knocking it back across the room, double swipe the second rat, punish the first
rat with a decapitation when it comes back for more, then finally break the back
of the surviving rat.

!room.notes += " 2 dead rats. 1 decapitated. 1 broken back."

You search through and around the casks looking for any possible loot.

; "Keoghtom's Ointment, doses: 1d4+1, heals 2d8+2" # @loot()

your front left pants pocket.

You find nothing else of interest.

you reach the center you notice the texture suddenly becomes very smooth.

sack in it.

You grope around in the pond feeling along its rough bottom. When you reach the
center you notice the texture suddenly becomes very smooth. Feeling around a
little more you find an edge you can probably pull up on.

You pull up on the edge and a large metal plate comes to the surface in your
grasp. Feeling down where it was you find a shallow depression with a sack in
it.

!qty_spiders= 3 # @qty_spiders: roll("1d3")
!room.notes = "3 spiders. loot sack."

!spider1=NPC.giant_spider()
!spider2=NPC.giant_spider()
!spider3=NPC.giant_spider()

Suddenly you hear several heavy thuds from behind you. Looking you see three
giant spiders between you and the exit.

look beyond the dead monk you see two figures moving into the torchlight.

;## ROOM: 3 (1)

;## see any other doors or passages leading from the room.

You step into a 90ft x 40ft room full of wine and ale casks, many of which
appear busted open. You don't see any doors or passages in the room.
!qty_rats= 4 # @qty_rats: roll("1d4")

; "" # @'' if turn % 20 != 0 else 'Torch starts guttering'

You start searching the room to see if any loot might be found in or under the
casks. Suddenly some casks that you were getting ready to search through shift
and four giant rats rush out to attack.

!rat1=NPC.giant_rat()
!rat2=NPC.giant_rat()
!rat3=NPC.giant_rat()
!rat4=NPC.giant_rat()

;;; !player.run_combat4([rat1, rat2, rat3, rat4])

; NPC party has initiative
; Giant Rat (59) hits Player for 9 points of damage
; Giant Rat (58) hits for 2 points and kills Player

;PC party perished

;Giant Rat (59) hit points = 12
;Giant Rat (57) hit points = 12

;Giant Rat (56) hit points = 12

!player.fate= 1 # @player.fate: player.fate - 1
; "Opposing forces attack each other or hurt themselves with own weapons" # @intervention()

FATE - 1. FATE POINTS REMAINING: 1.

They swarm over you, but seem to get in each other's way as they work to bite
and claw into you.

;;; !player.run_combat4([rat1, rat2, rat3, rat4])

; NPC party has initiative
; Giant Rat (58) hits Player for 1 points of damage
; Player hits Giant Rat (57) for 8 points of damage
; Player hits Giant Rat (59) for 8 points of damage
; Player hits for 4 points and Giant Rat (59) dies
; Giant Rat (58) hits Player for 1 points of damage
; Player hits Giant Rat (56) for 8 points of damage
; Player hits for 4 points and Giant Rat (56) dies
; Giant Rat (58) hits Player for 2 points of damage
; Player hits Giant Rat (58) for 2 points of damage
; Player hits for 10 points and Giant Rat (58) dies
; Player hits for 4 points and Giant Rat (57) dies

;NPC party perished

;Giant Rat (58) hit points = 0
;Giant Rat (57) hit points = 0
;Giant Rat (59) hit points = 0
;Giant Rat (56) hit points = 0

;Player hit points = 7
!player.hp = 7
!del rat1, rat2, rat3, rat4
!room.notes = "four dead giant rats."

The battle is on!

The third giant rat attacking hits you for 1 point damage. You strike back
hitting the 2nd and 4th rats, each for 8 points of damage. You swing back around
and strike the 4th rat for 4 points of damage, killing it.

The third rat scratches you for a single point of damage. You strike the first
rat with two quick axe chops for 8 and 4 points of damage. It drops dead.

The third rat gets a bite in. In retaliation you strike it twice, one for 2
points of damage, and a second time for 10 points of damage. It expires.

You take a final swing hitting the last giant rat for 4 points of damage ending
it.

!item= "Goggles of Night (darkvision 60ft)" # @item: loot()
!loot_item =  Item(item, location)
!loot_item # Goggles of Night (darkvision 60ft) (#2) <loc:3>

After digging around you find a pair of goggles.

Examining them closely you notice that when looking through the lenses, all the
darkness cast by the torch light disappears allowing you to see clearly.

;## ROOM: 2 (2)
;## Tiled floor cave with stone plynth
;## Dead monk with arrows in back next to plynth. Axe on plynth. 1d3 skeletons. 1d4 zombies.

!player.massive_attack=True
;;; !player.run_combat([skel1, skel2, skel3, zomb1])

; NPC party has initiative
; Skeleton Warrior (#19) hits Player for 4 points of damage
; Player uses talent massive attack
; Player hits Skeleton Warrior (#19) for 7 points of damage
; Player hits Skeleton Warrior (#21) for 2 points of damage
; Player hits Zombie (#14) for 1 points of damage
; Player hits Zombie (#14) for 1 points of damage
; Player hits for 2 points and Skeleton Warrior (#19) dies
; Player hits Zombie (#14) for 2 points of damage
; Player hits Skeleton Warrior (#20) for 5 points of damage
; Player hits for 7 points and Skeleton Warrior (#21) dies
; Player hits for 8 points and Zombie (#14) dies
; Player hits for 4 points and Skeleton Warrior (#20) dies

;NPC party perished

;Skeleton Warrior (#19) hit points = 0
;Zombie (#14) hit points = 0
;Skeleton Warrior (#20) hit points = 0
;Skeleton Warrior (#21) hit points = 0

;Player hit points = 7
;win

!del skel1
!del skel2
!del skel3
!del zomb1
!player.hp=7

You rush in to attack. The undead take whacks at you before you can land any
hits, but only one manages a lucky strike. A skeleton warrior hits you for 4
points of damage. Using your massive attack talent you strike a skeleton lopping
its head off. It collapses. You strike the next two skeletons gradually wearing
them down. Then the zombie gets into range and you whack it, leaving a gash
across its chest. Two of the skeletons work their way in front of the zombie,
but miss with their jabs. You lash out twice, doing some serious damage to the
first one and ending the animation of the second one. This leaves an opening for
the zombie which attacks again, but you fend off its claws easily. You strike it
down and put a final hit into the last warrior skeleton.

You walk over and pick up the axe, setting the torch to one side on the plynth,
and heft it. It has a very nice feel and seems to thrum slightly.

You realize that you aren't seeing the room in dark shadows anymore. Yes! The
axe grants magical sight!

You stow your old axe and equip the new two handed beast.

You search the rest of the room but find nothing of interest.

!old_axe = player.weapons[0]
!del player.weapons[0]
!old_axe.location="backpack"
!player.equipment.append(old_axe)
!del old_axe

!player.equip_weapon(dark_axe) # Axe (Dark Enchanted) (+1/+1). Two-handed.
!dark_axe.location="in hands"
!player.equipment.append(dark_axe)
!del dark_axe

rush out out of the cave and down the long passageway and come to the four way
intersection.

;## ROOM: 3 (1)
;## 90ft x 40ft room full of wine and ale casks. Many are open. You don't
;## see any other doors or passages leading from the room.
;## 1d4 giant rats nesting in casks

!qty= 1 # @qty: roll("1d4")
!rat = NPC.giant_rat()

!list_chars(locals()) # 
;## player: Player (HP: 4, XP: 0)
;## spider1: Giant Spider (#22) (HP: 24, XP: 0)

;## skel3: Skeleton Warrior (#83) (HP: 9, XP: 0)
;## rat: Giant Rat (#43) (HP: 12, XP: 0)

You rush down the stairs and enter a 90ft x 40ft room. You see casks and cask
pieces against the far wall. You hear the spider following along behind you.

Suddenly a giant rat busts out of the casks to your left and 3 skeleton
warriors raise up off the floor to your right!

You are boxed in good!

;Skeleton Warrior (32) hit points = 9

FATE - 1. NO FATE POINTS REMAINING.

You see the spider crawl in going down the stairs when it knocks a small pebble
skittering down the steps. This immediately attracts the attention of the rat
which attacks. Good, maybe they'll kill each other while you try and finish off
the skeletons.

;;; !rat.run_combat4([spider1])

; NPC party has initiative

; Giant Spider (2) hits for 9 points and kills Giant Rat (35)

;PC party perished

;Giant Spider (2) hit points = 24

;Giant Rat (35) hit points = 0

The spider does not give the rat a chance to strike, quickly sinking its fangs
into the rat's side. The spider picks up the corpse of the rat and proceeds
heading back up stairs.

;;; !player.run_combat4([skel1, skel2, skel3])

;PC party perished

;Skeleton Warrior (32) hit points = 9
;Skeleton Warrior (34) hit points = 9
;Skeleton Warrior (33) hit points = 9

;Player hit points = 0

The skeletons approach and before you know it you are in combat with the
undead. Each skeleton takes turns swinging at you. You fail to dodge two of
their strikes.

You have perished.

walls. You can't see into the alcoves from here. You push the portcullis open
with the sound of rusted screeching metal and step into the room. You can now
see into the alcoves and notice they are filled with the skeletons and corpses
of monks, except one. Which is in the right wall in the near corner.

; "Environmental. Lightning. Tunnel collapse. (8)." # @intervention()

Using your massive attack talent you strike out and hit a zombie for 10 points
of damage leaving a wide open gash across its chest. Another zombie gets past
your defense and rakes its clawed hands across one of your arms for 1 point of
damage. You return blows and hit two zombies for 3 points each of damage, then
strike a third decapitating it. It falls. One of zombies rakes it claws past
your defense and cause 1 point of damage to your left leg. You hear a buzzing
noise. You retaliate hitting it for 3 points of damage. Another zombie manages
to get its maw in to bite you across the left arm for 4 points of damage.
Everything is suddenly cast in a greenish hue as you hear a voice from above
saying, "Throw it into the portal you fool!" Your return attacks opens the chest
of one zombie which collapses to the floor and leaves a 2 point gash in another.
You hear a snap, the green hue vanishes, and you see a small crackling ball of
lightning fall and hit one of the zombies. It explodes scattering gore
everywhere.

You come to a natural cave. Water oozes down the walls and forms a 30ft
diameter pond in the middle of it. You notice water dripping from the cave roof
about 30ft above. From the pond a rivulet of water heads into a large crack in
the middle of the left wall which appears large enough to walk into. The pond is
covered in what appears to be a dark green scummy algae.
!qty_spiders= 2 # @qty_spiders: roll("1d3")

You step into the pond and grope around feeling along its rough bottom. When
you reach the center you notice the texture suddenly becomes very smooth.
Feeling around a little more you find an edge you can pull up on. You pull up on
the edge and a large metal plate comes to the surface in your grasp. You toss
the plate aside and feel down where it was. You find a shallow depression with a
sack in it.

Suddenly you hear hissing from the entrance. Turning, you see two giant spiders
rushing in to attack.

; "Potion of Health Drain. HP -2d4" # @loot()

!potion.description="A glass vial with a human heart etched into its surface."

wall you see a mummified corpse that is tied with barbed wire to a wooden X.

glass.

reveals nothing of interest.

;## ROOM: 2 (1)
;## You follow the passage for 50ft and come to a cave with a tiled floor.
;## You see a stone plynth on the far side holding a two handed war axe.
;## Even from this distance you can tell that it is a finely crafted
;## weapon. Next to the plynth on the floor you see the remains of a monk
;## with several arrows in its back. It looks like the monk was trying to

;## monk you see figures moving into the torchlight.
;## Dead monk with arrows in back next to plynth. Axe on plynth. 1d3 skeletons. 1d4 zombies.

; (True, '1d3 skeletons') # @wander()
; 3 # @roll("1d3")
!skel1 = NPC.skeleton_warrior()
!skel2 = NPC.skeleton_warrior()
!skel3 = NPC.skeleton_warrior()
!skel1.location=location
!skel2.location=location
!skel3.location=location
!room.notes = "Dead monk with arrows in back next to plynth. Axe on plynth. 3 warrior skeletons."
!list_chars(locals()) # 
;## player: Player (HP: 11, XP: 0)
;## skel1: Skeleton Warrior (#86) (HP: 9, XP: 0) <Room: 2>
;## skel2: Skeleton Warrior (#87) (HP: 9, XP: 0) <Room: 2>
;## skel3: Skeleton Warrior (#88) (HP: 9, XP: 0) <Room: 2>

You follow the passage for 50ft and come to a cave with a tiled floor. You see
a stone plynth on the far side holding a two handed war axe. Even from this
distance you can tell that it is a finely crafted weapon.

Next to the plynth on the floor you see the remains of a monk with several
arrows in its back. It looks like the monk was trying to reach the axe before
being struck down.

As you look beyond the dead monk you see figures moving into the torchlight.
Three warrior skeletons approach with swords up and shields at the ready.

You rush the skeletons intending to quickly dispatch them all and take the new
enticing axe.

!player.massive_attack=True
;;; !player.run_combat4([skel1, skel2, skel3], max_opponents=4)

; NPC party has initiative
; Player uses talent massive attack
; Player hits for 9 points and Skeleton Warrior 4 dies
; Player hits Skeleton Warrior 5 for 5 points of damage
; Player hits Skeleton Warrior 5 for 2 points of damage
; Skeleton Warrior 5 hits Player for 1 points of damage
; Player hits Skeleton Warrior 3 for 1 points of damage
; Skeleton Warrior 5 hits Player for 1 points of damage
; Player hits for 8 points and Skeleton Warrior 3 dies
; Player hits for 2 points and Skeleton Warrior 5 dies

;NPC party perished

;Skeleton Warrior 4 hit points = 0
;Skeleton Warrior 3 hit points = 0
;Skeleton Warrior 5 hit points = 0

;Player hit points = 9
!player.hp= 9 # @player.hp: 9
!del skel1, skel2, skel3

The skeletons take swings at you but you dock, dodge, and weave through their
sword strikes dealing damage as you go. You strike the first skeleton with your
massive attack skill across its skull which shatters. You strike the second
skeleton with to hacking slashes and deal 7 points of damage. The second
skeleton strikes back and hits you for 1 point of damage. You swing your axe
around and hit the third skeleton for 1 point of damage. The second skeleton
makes another successful strike and hits you for 1 point of damage. Swinging
your axe back around in a wide arc you shatter the skulls of the two remaining
skeletons.

HIT POINTS REMAINING: 9

You walk over, pickup, and examine the axe.

The blades are a solid black with red etchings following along their cutting
edges. The hand grip is wrapped in a black leather that is stamped with dark
blood red arcane symbols. The top of the handgrap has a circle of dark blood red
leather as does the bottom of the handgrip. From the edge of the hasp dangles a
dark blood red leather strip loop.

You feel a sense of malice eminating off of the axe, though it doesn't seem
directed at you.

Carefully setting your torch down on the plynth so not as to let it go out, you
heft the two-handed battle axe and test its weight and balance.

You suddenly notice something odd. All the shadows in the room seem to have
receded away from you. As you look about you see that the torch is still casting
shadows, but you can now see into them.

As a test you extinguish the torch and realize you can still see perfectly
fine! Setting the axe down on the plynth, you wait to see how long the effect
lasts. While there is a noticible immediate darkening of the room, the ability
seems to last quite a while. This seems handy, no torch required! You decide to
pick the axe back up and use it.

!player.weapon # Axe (+0/+0). (Axes) [+0/attack, 1d6x+0/damage]

!player.equipment.append(player.weapons[0].set_location("backpack"))
!del player.weapons[0]

pond in the middle of it. You notice water dripping from the cave roof about
30ft above. From the pond a rivulet of water heads into a large crack in the
middle of the left wall which appears large enough to walk into. The pond is
covered in what appears to be a dark green scummy algae.

!room # 
;## ROOM: 4-pond (1)
;## You step into the pond and grope around feeling along its rough
;## bottom. When you reach the center you notice the texture suddenly
;## becomes very smooth. Feeling around a little more you find an edge you
;## can pull up on. You pull up on the edge and a large metal plate comes
;## to the surface in your grasp. You toss the plate aside and feel down
;## where it was. You find a shallow depression with a sack in it.
;## :Set the sack down and fight :Loot sack and equip anything found before fighting

You step into the pond and grope around feeling along its rough bottom. When
you reach the center you notice the texture suddenly becomes very smooth.
Feeling around a little more you find an edge you can pull up on. You pull up on
the edge and a large metal plate comes to the surface in your grasp. You toss
the plate aside and feel down where it was. You find a shallow depression with a
sack in it.

As you pick up the sack you here loud hissing coming from the entrance. Turning
you see two charging giant spiders!

!player.fate # 2
;;; !player.run_combat4([spider1, spider2])

; NPC party has initiative
; Giant Spider (#32) <Room: 4> hits Player for 7 points of damage
; Giant Spider (#32) <Room: 4> hits for 2 points and kills Player

;PC party perished

;Giant Spider (#32) <Room: 4> hit points = 24
;Giant Spider (#33) <Room: 4> hit points = 24

;Player hit points = 0
;lose

!player.fate= 1 # @player.fate: player.fate - 1
; "Environmental. Lightning. Tunnel collapse. (7)." # @intervention()

As the two spiders rush towards you, a sudden avalanche of debris from above
piles on top of them.

!spider1.hp= 13 # @spider1.hp: spider1.hp - roll("3d8")
!spider2.hp= 10 # @spider2.hp: spider2.hp - roll("3d8")

While obviously hurt, the spiders shrug off the debris and advance.

; "Divine Intervention (18)." # @intervention()

FATE - 1. NO FATE POINTS REMAINING.

You can't move. Before you appears a two-handed axe dripping with blood and a
voice booms out:

"Ah! Entertainment! Agree to do a task for me and have a chance to live. Refuse
and you most certainly will die. There is an amulet secreted away on a shadow
plane where locations from this reality show up in that reality. Retrieving this
amulet then escaping the complex will result in your life being spared. After
obtaining the amulet, take it to a place of my choosing for a reward beyond just
your life."

:Accept task.|0b1d9f4b
:Refuse task.|3ea7cfca

You go 60 ft past the intersection and arrive at a natural cave. Water oozes
down the walls and forms a 30ft diameter pond in the middle of it. You notice
water dripping from the cave roof about 30ft above. From the pond a rivulet of
water heads into a large crack in the middle of the left wall which appears
large enough to walk into. The pond is covered in what appears to be a dark
green scummy algae.
!qty= 2 # @qty: roll("1d3")
!spider1=NPC.giant_spider().set_location("4a")
!spider2=NPC.giant_spider().set_location("4a")

and you most certainly will die. There is an amulet secreted away on a shadow
plane where locations from this reality show up in that reality. Retrieving this
amulet then escaping the complex will result in your life being spared. After
obtaining the amulet, take it to a place of my choosing for a reward beyond just
your life."

Using your massive attack talent, you strike the first rat for 11 points and
leave a deep gouge in its side. Your next swing damages the third rat for 6
points along its face. The first rat rakes at you with its claws for 1 point of
damage. You dodge more attacks then swing hitting the third rat for 5 points
with a follow up chop that ends its life. Unfortunately, the 2nd rat takes
advantage of your occupation with the third rat and grapples you from behind,
toppling you. You quickly succumb to the onslaught of teeth and claws.

You have perished.

You follow the passage down 60ft and come to a natural cave. Water oozes down
the walls and forms a 30ft diameter pond in the middle of it. You notice water
dripping from the cave roof about 30ft above. From the pond a rivulet of water
heads into a large crack in the middle of the left wall which appears large
enough to walk into. The pond is covered in what appears to be a dark green
scummy algae.
!qty_spiders= 1 # @qty_spiders: roll("1d3")
!notes=""
!spider1=NPC.giant_spider().set_location("4a")

forms a 30ft diameter pond in the middle of it. You notice water dripping from
the cave roof about 30ft above. From the pond a rivulet of water heads into a
large crack in the middle of the left wall which appears large enough to walk
into. The pond is covered in what appears to be a dark green scummy algae.

You enter a large natural cave. Water oozes down the walls and forms a 30ft
diameter pond in the middle. You notice water dripping from the cave roof about
30ft above. From the pond a rivulet of water heads into a crack to your left
which appears large enough to walk into. The pond is covered in what appears to
be a dark green scummy algae.

Starting on the right you grope around in the pond feeling along its rough
bottom. Not far far in and the the texture suddenly becomes very smooth in a
small square patch. Feeling around a little more you find an edge you can
probably pull up on.

You pull up on the edge and a small metal plate comes to the surface in your
grasp. Feeling down where it was you find a shallow depression with a sack in
it. You snatch the sack up out of the water.

!spider1 = NPC.giant_spider().set_location(location)
!spider2 = NPC.giant_spider().set_location(location)

Suddenly you hear two heavy thuds behind you. Looking you see two giant spiders
between you and the exit. As you turn to face them you hear gurgling noises
coming from the other side of the pond. Taking a quick glance, you see a
skeleton warrior climbing up from where it had been laying just under the
surface of the water.

;;; !player.run_combat([zombie, skeleton])

; PC party has initiative

You swing your axe back around and hit the skeleton for 6 points of damage with
your massive attack skill. The zombie takes advantage of your focus on the
skeleton and tears into you with its teeth and clawed hands.

You perish.

;## ROOM: 4 (1)
;## a natural cave. Water oozes down the walls and forms a 30ft diameter
;## pond in the middle of it. You notice water dripping from the cave roof
;## about 30ft above. From the pond a rivulet of water heads into a large
;## crack in the middle of the left wall which appears large enough to
;## walk into. The pond is covered in what appears to be a dark green
;## scummy algae.
;## 1d3 Giant Spiders in crack. Will attack if pond is searched and looted.

You step into a natural cave. Water oozes down the walls and forms a 30ft
diameter pond in the middle. You notice water dripping from the cave roof about
30ft above. From the pond a rivulet of water heads into a crack to your left
which appears large enough to walk into. The pond is covered in what appears to
be a dark green scummy algae. But what captures your attention the most is the
fight happening between two hungry giant spiders and a giant beetle who appears
about to become dinner.

;;; !beetle1.run_combat4([spider1, spider2])

; NPC party has initiative
; Giant Spider (#21) hits Giant Beetle (#3) for 5 points of damage
; Giant Spider (#21) hits for 9 points and kills Giant Beetle (#3)

;PC party perished

;Giant Spider (#21) hit points = 24
;Giant Spider (#22) hit points = 24

;Giant Beetle (#3) hit points = 0
!del beetle1
!spider1.name += f" (Room 4a, eating, will come out again after turn {turn+5})"
!spider2.name += f" (Room 4a, eating, will come out again after turn {turn+5})"

Both spiders quickly move in striking with their fangs injecting loads of venom
into the beetle. The beetle struggles to keep defending itself but quickly slows
then becomes still. As you stand there quietly, the spiders drag their dinner
into the large crack in the left wall and disappear into darkness.

twice, exhausting your mana, to regain your lost health.

You feel much better.

The passage across the intersection leads to the surface and is where you
entered the complex.

;## spider1: Giant Spider (#59) (HP: 24, XP: 0) (Room 4a, eating, will come out again after turn 12) (HP: 24, XP: 0)

!wandering_monster_1= "" # @wandering_monster_1: wander()
!wandering_monster_2= "" # @wandering_monster_2: '' if turn < 10 else wander()

;## ROOM: 4-pond (1)
;## You step into the pond and grope around feeling along its rough
;## bottom. When you reach the center you notice the texture suddenly
;## becomes very smooth. Feeling around a little more you find an edge you
;## can pull up on. You pull up on the edge and a large metal plate comes
;## to the surface in your grasp. You toss the plate aside and feel down
;## where it was. You find a shallow depression with a sack in it.
;## :Set the sack down and fight :Loot sack and equip anything found before fighting

Feeling a bit weak, you realize that healing yourself would be a good idea.

; "Cast succeeded. Healing Hand: Touch. 1d6 HP healed. Mana burn raises heal by +1." # @player.cast("Healing Hand")
!player.mana= 1 # @player.mana: player.mana
!heal= 4 # @heal: roll("1d6")
!player.hp= 9 # @player.hp: player.hp + heal

; "Cast succeeded. Healing Hand: Touch. 1d6 HP healed. Mana burn raises heal by +1." # @player.cast("Healing Hand")
!player.mana= 0 # @player.mana: player.mana
!heal= 3 # @heal: roll("1d6")
!player.hp= 12 # @player.hp: player.hp + heal

It takes two casts and depletion of your mana reserves, but you are back at
full strength.

You step into the pond and grope around feeling along its rough bottom. When
you reach the center you notice the texture suddenly becomes very smooth.
Feeling around a little more you find an edge you can pull up on. You pull up on
the edge and a large metal plate comes to the surface in your grasp. You toss
the plate aside and feel down where it was. You find a shallow depression with a
sack in it.

; "Amulet of Weakness, MAX HP -1d3" # @loot()
!max_hp_bns= -1 # @max_hp_bns: - roll("1d3")
!amulet = Item("Amulet of Weakness, Max HP: {max_hp_bns,+}", location)
!amulet # Amulet of Weakness, Max HP: {max_hp_bns,+} (#1) <loc:4-pond>

From within the sack you pull out a small amulet on a silver chain. Engraved on
it you see the picture of a human heart.

;## Location: 3way

;## ROOM: 2 (1)
;## You follow the passage for 50ft and come to a cave with a tiled floor.
;## You see a stone plynth on the far side holding a two handed war axe.
;## Even from this distance you can tell that it is a finely crafted

;## reach the axe before being struck down. As you look beyond the dead

;## Dead monk with arrows in back next to plynth. Axe on plynth. 1d3 skeletons. 1d4 zombies.

!qty_skel= 3 # @qty_skel: roll("1d3")
!qty_zomb= 1 # @qty_zomb: roll("1d4")

!skel1 = NPC.skeleton_warrior()
!skel2 = NPC.skeleton_warrior()
!skel3 = NPC.skeleton_warrior()
!zomb1 = NPC.zombie()

You follow the passage for 50ft and come to a cave with a tiled floor. You see
a stone plynth on the far side holding a two handed war axe. Even from this
distance you can tell that it is a finely crafted weapon. Next to the plynth on
the floor you see the remains of a monk with several arrows in its back. It
looks like the monk was trying to reach the axe before being struck down. As you
look beyond the dead monk you see figures moving into the torchlight and hear
the spider coming up from behind.

You realize this is not a good situtation as the figures resolve to be 3
skeleton warriors and a zombie. The only thing left to do is fight and hope!

!player.equipment_list # 
;## Chain, Defense: +5, Mana: -4
;## Axe (+0/+0).
;## Flint and tinder (#1)
;## Water flask (#1)
;## Blanket (#1)
;## Bed roll (#1)
;## Small tent (#1)
;## Backpack (#1)
;## Travel clothing (#1)
;## Iron rations 1 week (#1)
;## Pickaxe (#1)
;## Normal rations 1 week (#1)

;## Spellbook (#1)
;## Torch (#1) <loc:hand>
;## Torch (#2)
;## Torch (#3)
;## SP: 122 (#1)
;## Keoghtom's Ointment, doses: 2, heals 2d8+2 (#1) <loc:in pocket>

!turn= 6 # @turn: turn + 1
; (True, '1d2 spiders') # @wander()
!qty_spiders= 2 # @qty_spiders: roll("1d2")

!spider2 = NPC.giant_spider()
!spider3 = NPC.giant_spider()

;## spider3: Giant Spider (#62) (HP: 24, XP: 0)

;;; !player.run_combat4(opponents)

; Giant Spider (2) hits for 4 points and kills Player

;PC party perished

; "Environmental. Lightning. Tunnel collapse." # @intervention()

FATE - 1. NO FATE POINTS REMAINING.

Looking up, you see the spider crawling across the ceiling preparing to land on
you when suddenly a section of roof gives way and it falls. Much to your horror,
you see it crash into two other giant spiders that were crawling down the
passage after you!

!dmg= 1 # @dmg: roll("1d6x")
!spider1.hp -= dmg

Unfortunately it does not look like the fall did it or its friends any harm.

They swarm over you and quickly take your life.

You have perished.

You come back to the portcullis. Beyond you see a 90ft x 40ft room with alcoves
in the walls. You can't see into the alcoves from here. You push the portcullis
open with the sound of rusted screeching metal and step into the room. You can
now see into the alcoves and notice they are filled with the skeletons and
corpses of monks, except one. Which is in the right wall in the near corner.

;## ROOM: 5a (1)
;## a 40ft x 30ft room. All the walls are covered with depictions of evil
;## and bloody looking acts. On the far E wall you see a mummified corpse
;## that is tied with barbed wire to a wooden X. There is a small open
;## chest in the far corner of the room to the NE.

Opening the door and entering, you see a 40ft x 30ft room. All the walls are
covered with depictions of evil and bloody looking acts. On the far wall you see
a mummmified corpose that is tied with barbed wire to a wooden X.

There is a small open chest in the far corner of the room to your left.

; (False, '') # @wander()

!loot_qty= 3 # @loot_qty: roll("1d3")
;;; !loot_box(loot_qty)
; Keoghtaz's Ointment, doses: 1d4+1, damages 2d8+2
; Ring of Protection, BASE ARMOR +1
; Wand of Magic Missiles, 1d3 uses/day

Finally! Loot!

You walk over and examine the items in the chest.

!doses= 2 # @doses: roll("1d4+1")
!tin = Item(f"Keoghtaz's Ointment, doses: {doses}, damages 2d8+2", "5a")
!ring = Item(f"Ring of Protection, BASE ARMOR +1", "5a")
!uses= 1 # @uses: roll("1d3")
!wand = Item(f"Wand of Magic Missiles, {uses} uses/day", "5a")

You find a tin, a ring, and a wand.

Opening the tin you see a salve, partly used. A healing ointment maybe?

The ring is a plain silver band with a picture of a shield on the inner band.

The wand looks like willow wood and has a single glowing sliver of a blue gem
at its base.

crushing its chest, sending it toppling backwards into a heap. You hit the
zombie that was stabbed by the skeleton and it falls unmoving. You start hacking
and slashing into the remaining zombies and skeleton and chop them into heaps on
the floor.

Three zombies and two skeletons lie on the floor in various states of severe
damage.

grasp. You toss the plate aside and feel down where it was. You find a shallow
depression with a sack in it.
