;## ROOM: 4a (1)
;## You enter a very large crack in the cave wall and go about 30 ft and
;## notice the ground starting to slope upwards.
;## 1d3 Giant Spiders

You enter a very large crack in the cave wall and go about 30 ft and notice the
ground starting to slope upwards.
!qty_spiders= 1 # @qty_spiders: roll("1d2")

; (False, '') # @wander()

Suddenly a giant spider rushes you from ahead.

!spider1=NPC.giant_spider()

;;; !player.run_combat4([spider1])

; NPC party has initiative
; Player hits Giant Spider (#20) for 11 points of damage
; Player hits Giant Spider (#20) for 4 points of damage
; Giant Spider (#20) hits Player for 2 points of damage
; Player hits Giant Spider (#20) for 4 points of damage
; Player hits Giant Spider (#20) for 4 points of damage
; Giant Spider (#20) hits Player for 2 points of damage
; Player hits for 1 points and Giant Spider (#20) dies

;NPC party perished

;Giant Spider (#20) hit points = 0
!del spider1
;Player hit points = 7
!player.hp = 7

A mighty struggle ensues between you and hungry monster. The spider leaps at
you and you dodge. You quickly hammer in two axe chops for 11 points and 4
points of damage. The spider retaliates striking you with one of its legs for 2
points of damage. Again you strike two times for a total of 8 points of damage.
The spider looks weakened, but it still has fight as it slashes at you again
with a leg and causes another 2 points of damage. With a final swing of the axe,
you terminate the beast.

!room.notes="1 dead spider"

You continue following the passage and come to an opening to the outside. You
have found another way in and out of the complex.

You still have loot to seek.

;## ---> PLAYER IS INJURED AND NEEDS HEALING <---

the plate was you find a depression with a sack.

You stand in the doorway to keep them fighting you one at a time.

The zombies reach you first. Using your massive attack talent, you decapitate
the first zombie. The second zombie rakes its clawed hands at your armor,
getting through in one spot for 3 points of damage. You strike it back, hacking
deeply into its chest for 5 points of damage. It returns the favor and rakes you
for another 5 points of damage. You strike it once more, but only cause 1 point
of damage. It grabs you, pulls you close, and clamps its teeth about your neck.
Blood splashes everywhere as your life drains away.

You have perished and become a zombie.

;## ROOM: 3way (1)

You are at a three way intersection with openings behind you, to your left, and
straight ahead. The passageway to your left disappears into darkness. The
passageway behind you disappears into darkness. The passageway ahead of you goes
for 10ft past the intersection and ends at a set of stairs heading down.

Suddenly you hear a chittering noise from behind. You are under attack by a
giant beetle!

!player.fate # 1
;;; !player.run_combat4([beetle])

; PC party has initiative
; Player uses talent massive attack
; Player hits Giant Beetle (#5) for 7 points of damage
; Player hits Giant Beetle (#5) for 4 points of damage
; Player hits Giant Beetle (#5) for 2 points of damage
; Player hits for 1 points and Giant Beetle (#5) dies

;NPC party perished

;Giant Beetle (#5) hit points = 0

;Player hit points = 11
;win

You come to an open portcullis. Beyond you see a 90ft x 40ft room with alcoves
in the walls. You can see the alcoves are filled with the skeletons and corpses
of monks.

In the middle of the room, rushing towards you, is a very familiar looking
giant spider!

!qty= 3 # @qty:roll("1d3")
!skel1=NPC.skeleton_warrior()
!skel2=NPC.skeleton_warrior()
!skel3=NPC.skeleton_warrior()
!qty= 1 # @qty:roll("1d4")
!zomb1=NPC.zombie()
!room.notes= "open portcullis. 3 skeletons. 1 zombie." # @room.notes: "open portcullis. 3 skeletons. 1 zombie."

It's on!

;;; !player.run_combat4([spider1])

; NPC party has initiative
; Giant Spider (#1) <Room: 5> hits Player for 3 points of damage

;PC party perished

;Giant Spider (#1) <Room: 5> hit points = 24

;Player hit points = 0
;lose

!player.fate= 0 # @player.fate: player.fate - 1
; "Opposing forces attack each other or hurt themselves with own weapons (13)." # @intervention()

FATE - 1. NO FATE POINTS REMAINING.

As you watch in mounting horror, you see three skeletons and a zombie suddenly
rise up out of the alcoves and rush towards you with the spider!

Oh! Wait! Fate is being kind! They are attacking the spider!

;Zombie (#40) hit points = 0
;Skeleton Warrior (#42) hit points = 0
!del skel1, skel2, skel3, zomb1

;Giant Spider (#1) <Room: 5> hit points = 24
;win

Unfortunately, the spider obliterates the undead with its forelegs. In a blur
of motion you see if strike out shattering the skeletons one after the other
then it finally impales the zombie and flings it away.

Not a scratch! Not one of the undead did any damage to the monster!

It turns its attention back upon you. It looks annoyed.

You step into the pond and grope around feeling along its rough bottom. When
you reach the center you notice the texture suddenly becomes very smooth.
Feeling around a little more you find an edge you can pull up on. You pull up on
the edge and a large metal plate comes to the surface in your grasp. You toss
the plate aside and feel down where it was. You find a shallow depression with a
sack in it.

; "Potion of Invisibility" # @loot()

Dumping the sack out you find a potion. There is the picture of a dotted
outline of a person on the vial. No telling what it does. You stow the vial to
sell later.

!player.equipment.append(Item("Potion of Invisibility", "backpack"))

;## ROOM: 4 (1)

;## ROOM: 4a (1)
;## You enter a very large crack in the cave wall and go about 30 ft and
;## notice the ground starting to slope upwards.
;## 1d3 Giant Spiders

You enter a very large crack in the cave wall and go about 30 ft and notice the
ground starting to slope upwards. Suddenly you hear hissing from in front and
from behind. Waving you torch about you see two giant spiders come into view
from in front of you and one giant spider come into view behind you. You are
trapped!

;;; !player.run_combat4([spider1, spider2, spider3])

; NPC party has initiative
; Giant Spider (#35) hits Player for 6 points of damage
; Giant Spider (#7) hits for 5 points and kills Player
!player.hp= 5 # @player.hp: player.hp - 6

!player.fate= 1 # @player.fate: player.fate - 1
; "Opposing forces make a mistake, trip up, get in the way of each other (11)." # @intervention()

FATE - 1: FATE POINTS REMAINING 1.

The spiders are upon you. The one from behind strikes out and manages to sink
its fangs into your left leg. A second attacking spider whose strike would
surely have done you in, stumbles on something loose on the floor and misses.

;;; !player.run_combat4([spider1, spider2, spider3])

; NPC party has initiative
; Giant Spider (#35) hits for 5 points and kills Player

!player.fate= 0 # @player.fate: player.fate - 1
; "Opposing forces make a mistake, trip up, get in the way of each other (12)." # @intervention()

FATE - 1. NO FATE POINTS REMAINING.

The spider again strikes out towards you and again seems to stumble and misses
its mark.

;;; !player.run_combat4([spider1, spider2, spider3])

; NPC party has initiative
; Giant Spider (#6) hits for 5 points and kills Player

;PC party perished

;Giant Spider (#6) hit points = 24
;Giant Spider (#7) hit points = 24
;Giant Spider (#35) hit points = 24

;Player hit points = 0
;lose

The other two spiders seem to get tired of the first spiders ineffective
attacks and pile in shoving their fangs into your body deeply injecting you with
loads of venom.

You have become spider fodder.

You hear a horrible hissing from behind. Turning you see a giant spider
approaching.

;;; !player.run_combat4([spider1])

; NPC party has initiative
; Giant Spider (#27) hits for 11 points and kills Player

;PC party perished

;Giant Spider (#27) hit points = 24

;Player hit points = 0

!player.fate= 0 # @player.fate: player.fate - 1
; "Opposing forces make a mistake, trip up, get in the way of each other (9)." # @intervention()

FATE - 1. NO FATE POINTS REMAINING.

The giant spider leaps at you but misses widely as some stones shift under its
feet.

;;; !player.run_combat4([spider1])

; NPC party has initiative
; Player uses talent massive attack
; Player hits Giant Spider (#27) for 16 points of damage
; Player hits Giant Spider (#27) for 3 points of damage
; Player hits Giant Spider (#27) for 3 points of damage
; Player hits for 2 points and Giant Spider (#27) dies

;NPC party perished

;Giant Spider (#27) hit points = 0

;Player hit points = 11

Taking advantage of its bad luck, you use your massive attack talent and strike
down with your axe cracking its carapace open in a long oozing crack for 16
points of damage. You quickly hack and hack and hack the stunned creature for 3
points, another 3 points, and then finally 2 points of damage, killing it.

!room.notes="dead spider. long crack on carapace."

Search about you find nothing of interest.

You continue following the passage and come to an opening leading outside. You
have discovered another way into and out of the complex.

You have more loot to collect and head back down the tunnel back to the cave.

:Return to the cave with the pond.|9c444387

;## ROOM: 4 (1)
;## a natural cave. Water oozes down the walls and forms a 30ft diameter
;## pond in the middle of it. You notice water dripping from the cave roof
;## about 30ft above. From the pond a rivulet of water heads into a large

;## walk into. The pond is covered in what appears to be a dark green
;## scummy algae.
;## 1d3 Giant Spiders in crack. Will attack if pond is searched and looted.

You step into a natural cave. Water oozes down the walls and forms a 30ft
diameter pond in the middle of it. You notice water dripping from the cave roof
about 30ft above. From the pond a rivulet of water heads into a large crack in
the middle of the left wall which appears large enough to walk into. The pond is
covered in what appears to be a dark green scummy algae.
!qty_spiders= 2 # @qty_spiders: roll("1d3")
!spider1=NPC.giant_spider()
!spider1.location="4a"
!spider2=NPC.giant_spider()

You step into the pond and grope around feeling along its rough bottom. When
you reach the center you notice the texture suddenly becomes very smooth.
Feeling around a little more you find an edge you can pull up on. You pull up on
the edge and a large metal plate comes to the surface in your grasp. You toss
the plate aside and feel down where it was. You find a shallow depression with a
sack in it.

!spider1.location="4-pond"
!spider2.location="4-pond"

Glancing about you see two giant spiders advancing.

!list_items(locals()) # 

You have entered a 40ft x 30ft room. All the walls are covered with depictions
of evil and bloody looking acts. On the far wall you see a mummmified corpose
that is tied with barbed wire to a wooden X. There is a small open chest in the
far corner of the room to your left.

You proceed to search for useful items. You examine the corpse on the X cross,
but find nothing.

You then go over to the open chest and peer inside. You find a pair of boots.
Two pairs of gauntlets. And a set of goggles.

!loot_qty= 4 # @loot_qty: roll("2d4+1")

; "Gauntlets of Sapping Strength, WARRIOR -1d3" # @loot()

!goggles = Item("Goggles of Night (Darkvision 60ft)")
; "Gauntlets of Ogre Power, WARRIOR +1d3" # @loot()

You follow the passage for 50ft and come to a cave with a tiled floor. You see
a stone plynth on the far side holding a two handed war axe. Even from this
distance you can tell that it is a finely crafted weapon. Next to the plynth on
the floor you see the remains of a monk with several arrows in its back. It
looks like the monk was trying to reach the axe before being struck down. As you
look beyond the dead monk you see figures moving into the torchlight.

;## ROOM: 2 (2)
;## Tiled floor cave with stone plynth
;## Dead monk with arrows in back next to plynth. Axe on plynth.

!player.fate # 1
;;; !player.run_combat4([skel1, skel2, skel3, zomb1])

; NPC party has initiative
; Player uses talent massive attack
; Player hits for 9 points and Skeleton Warrior (#32) <Room: 2> dies
; Player hits Skeleton Warrior (#31) <Room: 2> for 2 points of damage
; Skeleton Warrior (#30) <Room: 2> hits Player for 5 points of damage
; Zombie (#29) <Room: 2> hits Player for 2 points of damage
; Zombie (#29) <Room: 2> hits Player for 2 points of damage
; Zombie (#29) <Room: 2> hits for 2 points and kills Player

;Skeleton Warrior (#32) <Room: 2> hit points = 0
;Skeleton Warrior (#30) <Room: 2> hit points = 9
;Skeleton Warrior (#31) <Room: 2> hit points = 7

;lose
!player.fate= 0 # @player.fate: player.fate - 1
; "Environmental. Lightning. Tunnel collapse. (8)." # @intervention()

FATE - 1. NO FATE POINTS REMAINING.

As they rush towards you, a section of the roof cracks open. Boulders, rocks,
and debris rain down on the undead.

!skel1.hp= -8 # @skel1.hp: skel1.hp - roll("3d8")
!skel2.hp= -11 # @skel2.hp: skel2.hp - roll("3d8")
!skel3.hp= -10 # @skel3.hp: skel3.hp - roll("3d8")
!zomb1.hp= 1 # @zomb1.hp: zomb1.hp - roll("3d8")

The zombie starts trying to claw its way out of the pile of rubble, but you put
and end to that quickly enough with a single stroke of the axe. All the undead
are squashed.

!zomb1.hp = 0

Walking over you set the torch down on the plynth and pick up the two-handed
weapon.

Amazingly your vision sharpens and you can see further than the torch light
casts. The thing grants darkvision!

You immediately put your axe away in your backpack and hefting the two handed
weapon decide what to do next.

!player.weapons[0].location="backpack"
!player.equipment.append(player.weapons[0])
!del player.weapons[0]
!player.equip_weapon(dark_axe.set_location("equipped")) # Axe (Dark Enchanted) (+1/+1). Two-handed. <loc:equipped>

;Player hit points = 0

points of damage. It retaliates with a bite taking 2 points of your health. You
hack at it again and it drops to the floor twitching. The third rat takes
advantage of your distraction with the fourth rat and neatly severes you head
from you body in a single bite.

You have perished.

;## 1 (visited):

!player.hit_points # 4
!player.weapon # Axe (+0/+0). (Axes) [+0/attack, 1d6x+0/damage]

;## Chain, Defense: +5, Mana: -4
;## Axe (+0/+0).

;## player: Player (HP: 4, XP: 0)
;## spider1: Giant Spider (#22) (HP: 24, XP: 0) <Room: 1>
;## skel1: Skeleton Warrior (#84) (HP: 9, XP: 0) <Room: 5>
;## zomb1: Zombie (#103) (HP: 12, XP: 0) <Room: 5>

!list_items(locals()) # 

!turn= 6 # @turn: turn + 1
; (False, '') # @wander()

!room # 
;## ROOM: 5 (2)
;## Crypt of dead monks
;## 1 skeletons. 1 zombies. 

; "" # @'' if turn % 20 != 0 else 'Torch starts guttering'

You carefully look over the alcoves. You see a mixture of monk warrior
skeletons and monk corpes in all the alcoves but one. In the right wall you see
one alcove that is empty. Walking over to the empty alcove you see it is
actually a cleverly disguised door leading to another area!

!location= "5a"
!room=rooms(location)
!room # 
;## ROOM: 5a (1)
;## a 40ft x 30ft room. All the walls are covered with depictions of evil
;## and bloody looking acts. On the far E wall you see a mummified corpse
;## that is tied with barbed wire to a wooden X. There is a small open
;## chest in the far corner of the room to the NE.

You are at the entrance to a 40ft by 30ft room. All the walls are covered with
depictions of evil and bloody looking acts. On the far wall you see a mummified
corpse that is tied with barbed wire to a wooden X. There is a small open chest
in the far corner of the room to the left.

!loot_qty= 3 # @loot_qty: roll("2d4 + 1")
;;; !loot_box(loot_qty)
; Boots of Striding and Springing, ROGUE +1d3
!bns= 2 # @bns: roll("1d3")
!boots = Item(f"Boots of Striding and Springing, +{bns}")
; Gloves of Swimming and Climbing
!gloves = Item(f"Gloves of Swimming and Climbing")
; Ring of Slowness, DEFENSE -1
!ring = Item(f"Ring of Slowness, Rogue -1")

You enter the room and immediately notice that except for the cross with the
mummified corpse that the only other item of interest is the open chest. Walking
over to it you see three items inside.

* A pair boots
* A pair of gloves
* A ring

;## ---> PLAYER IS BADLY INJURED AND NEEDS HEALING <---

:Examine Gear.|20f88150

!location # 5a
; @location: ""
!room=rooms(location)
!room # 
;## ROOM: 5a (2)
;## A room with a dead monk on an X cross.

Feeling weak, you realize your health is low and cast healing hand exhausting
your mana.

; "Cast succeeded. Healing Hand: Touch. 1d6 HP healed. Mana burn raises heal by +1." # @player.cast("Healing Hand")
!player.mana= 0 # @player.mana: player.mana - 1
!player.hp= 9 # @player.hp: player.hp + roll("1d6")

You feel revitalized. (HP +5, 9/11 HP)

; (True, '1d2 zombies') # @wander()
!qty= 2 # @qty: roll("1d2")

You hear moaning coming from the entrance. Looking up from where you were
preparing to go through the gear, you see two zombies approaching.
!zomb2=NPC.zombie()
!zomb3=NPC.zombie()
;;; !player.run_combat4([zomb1, zomb2])

; PC party has initiative
; Player hits Zombie (74) for 11 points of damage
; Zombie (74) hits Player for 1 points of damage
; Player hits Zombie (75) for 3 points of damage
; Player hits Zombie (75) for 5 points of damage
; Player hits Zombie (75) for 1 points of damage
; Player hits for 1 points and Zombie (74) dies
; Player hits for 3 points and Zombie (75) dies

;NPC party perished

;Zombie (75) hit points = 0
;Zombie (74) hit points = 0
!del zomb2
!del zomb3

;Player hit points = 8
!player.hp= 8 # @player.hp: 8

The zombies attack with surprising ferocity. You dodge their initial strikes,
and you manage to hack the first zombie's head mostly off in a single swing, but
it keeps attacking. It manages to scratch you for 1 point of damage. In
retaliation you hack at the zombies repeatably until they both drop. It takes
four hits to take out the second zombie. But only two for the first.

You start examining the gear, picking each item up each in turn carefully and
considering it.

!room.notes+=" 2 dead zombies."

!list_items(locals()) # 
;##  boots: Boots of Striding and Springing, +2 (#1)
;##  gloves: Gloves of Swimming and Climbing (#1)
;##  ring: Ring of Slowness, Rogue -1 (#1)

You pick up the boots. Covered in a black soft felt material they seem superbly
made and expensive.

Turning the gloves over in your hand, you notice they are webbed between the
fingures and have tiny bowl like indentations on the fingure tips.

The ring is flat black color, making it look ideal for something for sneaking
around if it has magic. Looking inside the inner band on the ring, you see a
pair of shoes with wings on them.

;## A room with a dead monk on an X cross.
;##  2 dead zombies.

You put the boots on and find them a perfect fit! The gloves seem to improve
you grip on the axe handle. And the ring is just fancy!

!boots.location="feet"
!player.rogue_mod= 2 # @player.rogue_mod: player.rogue_mod + 2
!gloves.location="hands"
!ring.location="right hand f1"
!player.rogue_mod= 1 # @player.rogue_mod: player.rogue_mod - 1
!player.equipment.extend([boots, gloves, ring])
!del boots, gloves, ring

Search about the room you find nothing else of interest.

!facing="s"

!room=rooms(location)

;## ROOM: 5 (3)
;## Crypt of dead monks
;## 1 skeletons. 1 zombies.

;Zombie (#5) <Room: 5> hit points = 12

;Player hit points = 0
;lose

!player.fate= 0 # @player.fate: player.fate - 1
; "Opposing forces make a mistake, trip up, get in the way of each other (11)." # @intervention()

FATE - 1. NO FATE POINTS REMAINING.

As the skeleton jabs its rusty sword towards you, the zombie gets in the way of
the thrust and is pierced by the weapon's point.

!zomb1.hp= 1 # @zomb1.hp: skel1.damage_opponent(zomb1)

;;; !player.run_combat4([skel1, zomb1])

; PC party has initiative
; Player uses talent massive attack
; Player hits Skeleton Warrior (#5) <Room: 5> for 6 points of damage
; Player hits for 1 points and Zombie (#5) <Room: 5> dies
; Player hits for 3 points and Skeleton Warrior (#5) <Room: 5> dies

;NPC party perished

;Zombie (#5) <Room: 5> hit points = 0
;Skeleton Warrior (#5) <Room: 5> hit points = 0

;Player hit points = 8
;win

Taking the initative and striking while the zombie tries to unimpale itself
from the skeletons sword, you strike the skeleton, crushing its chest, then
decapitate the zombie. With a final swish of your axe you also decapitate the
skeleton warrior.

Quickly searching through the alcoves you find nothing of value.

You continue down the passageway heading back to the 4-way intersection.

!del zomb1, skel1

;##  bag: Bag of Devouring (#1)
;##  gauntlets: Gauntlets of Sapping Strength, Warrior -2 (#1)
;##  ring: Ring of Cold Resistance. Tourmaline. (#1)

; (False, '') # @wander()

!room # 
;## ROOM: 5a (3)
;## A room with a dead monk on an X cross.

; "" # @'' if turn % 20 != 0 else 'Torch starts guttering'

You pick the amulet up and examine it closely. It is bronze in color, feels
warm to the touch, and has engravings of individual fists on both sides. It
feels like you should put it on.

You pick up the armor and examine it closely. It appears to be expertly crafted
scale mail. Definitely looks better than one you normally find available for
sale with merchents.

The bag is made of a expensive fine black velvet with a black leather
drawstring. You hear clinking when you pick it up.

You pick up the gauntlets and look over them carefully. They are bronze in
color with decorative swirls surrounding various engravings of fists and large
firm biceps. It feels like you should equip this gear.

You pick up the ring. It is a simple band with a tourmaline set into it. You
notice faint engravings of snowflakes on the inner band.

You pick up the wand and examine it closely. It looks to be made of willow
tree. Near its base you see 4 tiny blue gem stone slivers. One of them appears
dark. The other three glow with a faint inner light.

You pick up the mace and examine it. About 2ft long, it is made of steel and
ends in a spiked head. It is plain looking not having any decorations.

NO FATE POINTS REMAINING.

You wake up on the top of a barren hill. You see a two-handed black axe, a set
of black chain mail armor, and a flight of stairs heading down into the ground.

Looking about you see a purple sky filled with green stars. There are
occasional forks of lightning off in the distance and orange flashes on the
horizon in all directions. Looking down from the barren hilltop you see that
everything past the base of the hill is shrouded is a deep gloom with some sort
of sea composed of roiling black fog all around. You get the feeling if you walk
down into the black fog, you would not come back out.

You realize that all of your stuff is gone. You only have what clothes you are
wearing!

You hear squeaking noises coming from the stairwell.
